result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda M. Bomstein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Concealing Death of Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.23.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent including parenting/mentorship when she has children in her care. Must inform agent of any pregnancies w/in 2 hours of discovering that fact.   Defendant has 199 days credit if probation revoked.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Forthwith
Consecutive to: to any other sentence/commitment

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Atty Frank notes corrections to the PSI.  A.B. makes a statement on behalf of DE.  M.B. makes statement on behalf of DE.  State makes recommendation.  Atty Frank makes his recommendation.  DE makes statement on her own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Ct 1:  
Probation for 3 years
Conditions of probation:
6 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence to commence forthwith
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Treatment/counseling per agent including parenting/mentorship when she has children in her care
Must inform her agent of any pregnancies w/in 2 hours of discovering that fact
199 days sentence credit if probation is revoked

ADDRESS INFO for Brenda M. Bomstein
Current: 1300 Lange Court, Sauk Co. Jail, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 10-27-2015)
Prior: 207 Monroe St, # 202, Lake Delton, WI 53940

Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in court with attorney Mark W. Frank.  Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Frank advises of plea today and set out for sentencing.  State gives agreement re: PSI and free to argument any sentence.  Attorney Frank agrees.  Plea to Count 1.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.  Court goes through right to an attorney.  Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI to be filed by October 5, 2015.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in court with attorney Mark W. Frank.  Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 3.

Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in court with attorney Mark W. Frank. Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond.  State objects to motion.  Atty. Frank makes bail argument to be released to R.M. along with work, recites a letter in file.  Requests Signature or low cash bail.  State makes argument - not likely to return due to charges, past failure to appears & concerns to the court of whereabouts.  Atty. Frank makes redirect of argument.  Court states there are some unanswered questions, explains the purpose of bail.  Court not persuaded that bail is too high.  Court denies motion.

Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in court with attorney Mark W. Frank.  Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank notes DE will waive her right to prelim today.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Arraignment and motion re: bond to be set in Br 3.  Bond continued.

Pre-trial conference at 05-29-2015 08:30 am.
Return date at 06-11-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Brenda M. Bomstein in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests $10,000 cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds/requests signature bond.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  $10,000.00 cash bond set.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Court sets PTC and RD.  DE advised of right to an attorney.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
